title: COVID-19
cleaned_text: COVID-19 SHARE Prepare and Stay Healthy Get vaccinated and stay up to date with all recommended doses. - All New Yorkers 6 months and older should [get vaccinated](https://covid19vaccine.health.ny.gov/)and get their [booster dose](https://covid19vaccine.health.ny.gov/booster-doses)when eligible. - If you are [experiencing symptoms](https://www.health.ny.gov/diseases/communicable/respiratory_syncytial_virus/understanding.htm)or were exposed, [get tested](https://www.hhs.gov/coronavirus/community-based-testing-sites/index.html). - If you test positive, stay home and talk to your healthcare provider about [treatment](https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/covid-19-treatments). - On February 10, 2023, NYSDOH [updated recommendations](https://health.ny.gov/professionals/hospital_administrator/letters/2023/docs/dal_23-02.pdf)for the use of masks and face coverings that all healthcare settings in New York should follow during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. - All travelers, [domestic](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/travel-during-covid19.html)and [international](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/international-travel-during-covid19.html), should continue to follow all CDC travel requirements. [](/get-tested) Find a test site near you and learn what to do if you test positive. [](/get-treatment) Do not wait to get treated. COVID-19 medications are now widely available. [](/get-vaccinated-boosted) Getting vaccinated is your best defense against COVID-19. Resources for New Yorkers Information about common respiratory illnesses. FEMA will provide financial assistance for COVID-19-related funeral expenses. Check COVID-19 Data in Your Community Stay updated on COVID-19 in your area. Our data pages include case rates, hospitalizations, fatalities, vaccinations, variants, and more.
